content.para: The 3.4.0 release introduces a native C# / .NET API to clustering algorithms as well as

tr.td:
C# / .NET API
Download
View API reference online
Getting started

Starting with release 3.4.0, provides a native C# API for calling clustering from C# / .NET software:
All required DLL files, C# code examples and API reference included
No need to install Java JRE/SDK
Clustering engine feature set identical to Java version
Clustering results identical to Java version
Clustering performance comparable to Java version in case of the STC algorithm. Due to highly computational nature of Lingo, its C# version is slower than the Java counterpart.
Works with .NET Framework 3.5 or later
As of version 3.4.0, stops supporting Java 1.5, which reached its End of Service Life in October 2009.

Versions prior to 3.4.0 depended on Lucene 3.x API, which could cause integration problems in systems relying on earlier versions of Lucene. Version 3.4.0 completely removes the dependency on Lucene API and as a result, will not interfere with earlier and future releases of Lucene.
MSN Live document source has been replaced with Bing.
The OpenSearch document source is now available in .

A number of dependencies have been updated:
Mahout Math and Collections to version 0.3
High Performance Primitive Collections to version 0.3.1
Google Collections replaced with Guava
SimpleXML to version 2.3.5
Jackson JSON to version 1.5.2

content.p: For a complete list of improvements and bug fixes, see JIRA issues fixed in version 3.4.0. For more new features, please see release 3.3.0 and release 3.2.0 notes.
